00076 /*
00077  * @brief Start conflating. After this call, MAMA routes outbound messages 
00078  * through the conflation manager until the publisher calls end().
00079  *
00080  * @param[in] mgr The mama conflation manager
00081  *
00082  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00083  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00084  *              MAMA_STATUS_CONFLATE_ERROR
00085  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00086  */
00087 mama_status
00088 mamaConflationManager_start (mamaConflationManager mgr);
00089 
00090 /* 
00091  * @brief End conflation. Invoking this method flushes the queue and resumes
00092  * sending messages directly through the transport. Calling start() 
00093  * again restarts conflation.
00094  *
00095  * @param[in] mgr The mama conflation manager
00096  *
00097  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00098  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00099  *              MAMA_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED
00100  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00101  */
00102 mama_status
00103 mamaConflationManager_end (mamaConflationManager mgr);
00104 
00105 /*
00106  * @brief If set, new messages are passed to the specified callback rather than
00107  * being queued directly to the conflation queue. If it is set to NULL or
00108  * not set, new messages are automatically appended to the end of the
00109  * conflation queue in the conflation manager.
00110  *
00111  * @details In general this method should be called prior to invoking start(). 
00112  *
00113  * @details If you subclass the MamaConflationManager, you can override the 
00114  * mamaConflationManager_enqueue (mamaConflationManager mgr) method rather than setting the enqueue callback.
00115  *
00116  * @param[in] mgr      The mama conflation manager
00117  * @param[in] callback Conflation manager callback
00118  * @param[in] closure  User supplied data
00119  *
00120  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00121  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00122  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00123  */
00124 mama_status
00125 mamaConflationManager_setEnqueueCallback (mamaConflationManager         mgr,
00126                                           mamaConflationEnqueueCallback callback,
00127                                           void*                         closure);
00128 
00129 /*
00130  * @brief Enqueue a message to the MamaConflationManager's queue. If there is no
00131  * MamaConflationEnqueueCallback specified, the conflation manager invokes
00132  * this automatically. Applications may call this from the Enqueue callback
00133  * to append the message to the queue.
00134  *
00135  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00136  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00137  *
00138  * @param[in] mgr   The mama conflation manager
00139  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00140  * @param[in] topic The Topic 
00141  *
00142  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00143  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00144  *              MAMA_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED
00145  *              MAMA_STATUS_NOMEM
00146  */
00147 mama_status
00148 mamaConflationManager_enqueue (mamaConflationManager mgr, 
00149                                mamaMsg msg,
00150                                const char* topic);
00151 
00152 /*
00153  * @brief Remove the first message from the queue. This method blocks if the queue is empty.
00154  *
00155  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00156  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00157  *
00158  * @param[in] mgr   The mama conflation manager
00159  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00160  * @param[in] topic The topic
00161  *
00162  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00163  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00164  *              MAMA_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED
00165  *              MAMA_STATUS_CONFLATE_ERROR
00166  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00167  */
00168 mama_status
00169 mamaConflationManager_dequeue(mamaConflationManager mgr, 
00170                               mamaMsg* msg,
00171                               const char** topic);
00172 
00173 /* 
00174  * @brief Remove a message from the queue. If the queue is empty, return immediately.
00175  *
00176  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00177  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00178  *
00179  * @param[in] mgr   The mama conflation manager
00180  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00181  * @param[in] topic The topic
00182  *
00183  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00184  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00185  *              MAMA_STATUS_NOT_INSTALLED
00186  *              MAMA_STATUS_CONFLATE_ERROR
00187  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00188  */
00189 mama_status
00190 mamaConflationManager_poll(mamaConflationManager mgr, 
00191                            mamaMsg *msg,
00192                            const char** topic);
00193 
00194 /*
00195  * @brief Send a message. Pass the message to the transport to be sent. This
00196  * message does not return to the conflation queue, it gets sent over the
00197  * network.
00198  *
00199  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00200  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00201  *
00202  * @param[in] mgr   The mama conflation manager
00203  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00204  * @param[in] topic The topic
00205  *
00206  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00207  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00208  *              MAMA_STATUS_NOT_IMPLEMENTED
00209  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00210  */
00211 mama_status
00212 mamaConflationManager_publish (mamaConflationManager mgr, 
00213                                mamaMsg msg,
00214                                const char* topic);
00215 
00216 /*
00217  * @brief Send all the messages on the queue until it is empty.
00218  *
00219  * @param[in] mgr The mama conflation manager
00220  *
00221  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00222  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00223  *              MAMA_STATUS_CONFLATE_ERROR
00224  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00225  */
00226 mama_status
00227 mamaConflationManager_flush (mamaConflationManager mgr);
00228 
00229 /*
00230  * In addition to enqueue() and dequeue() the following methods allow the
00231  * conflation algorithm to manipulate the outbound message queue. After 
00232  * invoking mamaConflationManager_start (mamaConflationManager mgr), 
00233  * conflation manager positions its iterator at the 
00234  * first message in the mamaConflationManager_queue (mamaConflationManager mgr
00235  * the message that dequeue() would remove).
00236  */
00237 
00238 /* @brief Get the current message without removing it. Or advancing the iterator.
00239  * Returns MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_END if the queue is empty.
00240  *
00241  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00242  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00243  * 
00244  * @param[in] mgr   The mama conflation manager
00245  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00246  * @param[in] topic The topic
00247  *
00248  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00249  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00250  *              MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_END
00251  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00252  */
00253 mama_status
00254 mamaConflationManager_currentMsg (mamaConflationManager mgr, 
00255                                   mamaMsg* msg,
00256                                   const char** topic);
00257 
00258 /* 
00259  * @brief Get the next message in the queue. Returns MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_END if the
00260  * iterator is at the end of the queue.
00261  *
00262  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00263  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00264  * 
00265  * @param[in] mgr   The mama conflation manager
00266  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00267  * @param[in] topic The topic
00268  *
00269  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00270  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00271  *              MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_END
00272  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00273  */
00274 mama_status
00275 mamaConflationManager_nextMsg (mamaConflationManager mgr, 
00276                                mamaMsg* msg,
00277                                const char** topic);
00278 
00279 /* 
00280  * @brief Get the previous message in the queue. Returns MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_END if the
00281  * iterator is at the beginning of the queue.
00282  *
00283  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00284  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00285  * 
00286  * @param[in] mgr   The mama conflation manager
00287  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00288  * @param[in] topic The topic
00289  *
00290  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00291  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00292  *              MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_END
00293  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00294  */
00295 mama_status
00296 mamaConflationManager_prevMsg (mamaConflationManager mgr,
00297                                mamaMsg* msg,
00298                                const char** topic);
00299 
00300 /* @brief Remove and return the current message. The iterator advances to the next 
00301  * message. Returns MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_END if queue not positioned on valid
00302  * element.
00303  *
00304  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00305  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00306  *
00307  * @param[in] mgr   The mama conflation manager
00308  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00309  * @param[in] topic The topic
00310  *
00311  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00312  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00313  *              MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_END
00314  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00315  */
00316 mama_status
00317 mamaConflationManager_removeMsg (mamaConflationManager mgr, 
00318                                  mamaMsg* msg,
00319                                  const char** topic);
00320 
00321 /* @brief Insert a message in front of the current message. 
00322  *
00323  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00324  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00325  * 
00326  * @param[in] mgr   The mama conflation manager
00327  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00328  * @param[in] topic The topic
00329  *
00330  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00331  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00332  *              MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_FULL
00333  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00334  */
00335 mama_status
00336 mamaConflationManager_insertBefore (mamaConflationManager mgr,
00337                                     mamaMsg msg,
00338                                     const char* topic);
00339 
00340 /* @brief Insert a message behind the current message
00341  *
00342  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00343  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00344  * 
00345  * @param[in] mgr The mama conflation manager
00346  * @param[in] msg   The mama message
00347  * @param[in] topic
00348  * @param[in] topic The topic
00349  *
00350  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00351  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00352  *              MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_FULL
00353  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00354  */
00355 mama_status
00356 mamaConflationManager_insertAfter (mamaConflationManager mgr,
00357                                    mamaMsg msg,
00358                                    const char* topic);
00359 
00360 /* @brief Replace the current message. Return message being replaced 
00361  *
00362  * @details NOTE: Applications should not modify messages as the data may be shared
00363  * in the underlying middleware for efficiency. Use mamaMsg_copy().
00364  *
00365  * @param[in] mgr The mama conflation manager
00366  * @param[in] newMsg
00367  * @param[in] topic
00368  * @param[in] topic The topic
00369  *
00370  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00371  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00372  *              MAMA_STATUS_QUEUE_FULL
00373  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00374  */
00375 mama_status
00376 mamaConflationManager_replaceMsg (mamaConflationManager mgr,
00377                                   mamaMsg newMsg,
00378                                   const char* topic);
00379 
00380 /* @brief Put the iterator at the tail of the queue. Algorithms that
00381  * process the most recent message first may use this.
00382  *
00383  * @param[in] mgr The mama conflation manager
00384  *
00385  * @return mama_status return code can be one of:
00386  *              MAMA_STATUS_INVALID_ARG
00387  *              MAMA_STATUS_CONFLATE_ERROR
00388  *              MAMA_STATUS_OK
00389  */
00390 mama_status
00391 mamaConflationManager_gotoTail (mamaConflationManager mgr);
